headline: Blueberry Coffee Cake
description: Moist blueberry coffee cake baked in a Bundt pan with fresh berries and a layer of sweet cinnamon streusel. Perfect for breakfast with a hot cup of coffee.

video.description: This dense, moist cake is easy to assemble and perfect with coffee.
video.name: Blueberry Coffee Cake I

name: Blueberry Coffee Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Make the streusel: Mix brown sugar, flour, and cinnamon together in a medium bowl. Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly.
Make the cake: Generously spray a fluted tube pan (such as Bundt) with cooking spray. Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl.

Beat butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer until creamy. Add sugar and beat until fluffy. Beat in egg and vanilla. Add flour mixture in two batches, alternating with milk, beating batter briefly after each addition.
Spread 1/2 of the batter in the prepared pan. Sprinkle blueberries over top, then add remaining batter, one spoon at a time. Sprinkle streusel over top.
Bake in the preheated oven until deep golden brown, 55 to 60 minutes. Set on a wire rack to cool, about 30 minutes.
Invert cake onto a plate and dust with confectioners' sugar.

review.reviewBody: I increased the milk to 1 cup an added 1/2 cup of water. I also used frozen berries, turn out great with the modifications

I have made many coffee cakes. This recipe needs to modified greatly. This is not a 4.5 start recipe. The liquid ratio is off. The baking time then needs to be modified along with most of the ingredients. The streusel topping dry ingredients should be reduced by a third at least for a proper cut in. The taste is decent but this was a flat disaster.

The coffee cake was good but I have to agree the mix was very dry so I also added additional milk and more blueberries and although I added more blueberries than recommended I don't think it would have been as good with the small amount that was suggested.

Very good ! I made it according to the recipe with one exception. I added extra milk to the batter because it was so thick. I also used a few extra blueberries. I've eaten some already and Iook forward to having more with my morning coffee.
I have made it many times now. My friends love it and I take it to brunches.
Great recipe
The batter was very thick and the strudel topping was not crumbled, it was more like a batter

I always read reviews prior to making to see if someone else had issues. I pretty much made the cake as instructed but went with 3/4 cups of sugar & I added 1 & a 1/2 cups of fresh blueberries. For the topping, I halved it, as I watch my sugar content. It turned out great, love it and will make again and again.

Mine did not rise properly, I know the baking powder is new, I was wondering if the flour was no good due to the humidity in the house. I put the struessel on top of blueberries in middle, all and all, it is still yummy, but don't look like the picture.

Tip1: add more vanilla than the recipe to your liking 
Tip 2: double or triple the milk in the batter to your liking. The original batter is too dry
Tip 3: layer the topping in the middle with the blueberries as well as layering it last otherwise you’ll have topping left over
Tip 4: if you like more blueberries then add more
Tip 5: this recipe could be used with strawberries or peaches and would be delicious but the water content is higher in those fruits so be aware.

My family loved this coffee cake! I only reduced the amount of streusel topping because it calls for way too much! I also used a gluten free flour mix because I have Celiac. Otherwise it turned out so pretty my mom said it was a shame to eat it but we did. It really was delicious!

Don’t use cooking spray- mine got stuck and broke apart . Tasted fine but you need to butter and flour the pan and cool COMPLETELY before you invert it. 
But make this- it tastes yummy.
Delicious. The top stuck in the pan. Next time I'll add flour in the pan to prevent sticking.
Had to use a 6-cup Bundt pan

The sides were too hard and the inside did not hold together. I had to serve it with spoons. If I made it again, I would adjust oven temp downward 25 degrees and cut brown sugar by 25% and cut baking time by 10 minutes and add more blueberries and vanilla.
This was so delicious and easy to make! Thanks for sharing...it's a keeper!
I made muffins with recipe. Boys loved it. (8 & 9)
The streusel topping is a little much. If I make it again I’m cutting the recipe to 3/4.
I will for sure make this again! It was so easy and tasted amazing! I think next time I might make the crust a little thinner.

So so so good! I didn’t have a Bundt mold so I made it like a normal cake. This is by far the best blueberry crumble cake I have ever had. It’s sweet enough with the brown crumble that I don’t think it needs the powdered sugar on top! 10/10!
I made it with some revisions that other people made such as 3/4 cup of buttermilk and 1 1/2 cups of blueberries. Also I sprinkled the streusel on the blueberries. It was DELICIOUS!!
I thought it went together well, only change: I put the streusel in the middle and the cake came apart coming out of the pan. Flavor good...but it's in pieces .

Followed other reviewer's tips and added 3/4 milk and 1 1/2 blueberries. I coated the berries lightly in flour before folding into the batter. I halved the streusel and sprinkled it both in the middle and on the bottom of the cake.

After reading reviews, I made some changes, and it turned out perfect for me! I used splenda brown sugar and splenda white sugar because we have a diabetic in our family. Make sure if you use splenda, cut the amount of each kind of sugar in half. 
I thought 2 sticks of butter in the cake was a bit much, so I used 1/2 cup canola oil in the cake batter, but didn't adjust the amount of flour. I put flour on the blueberries, and folded them into the cake batter. 
I used an 8x11 glass pan, sprayed with Pam cake flour. I put 1/2 of the batter in, then sprinkled 1/2 of the topping, then layered the rest. 38 minutes at 350 degrees.
I failed! Not sure how but I did.
There is not enough batter. There is so much streusel that you can put it in the middle and on top. With so little batter it is hard to cover the filling. Would give it 4 stars with more batter.

Yum! I made a couple modifications upon reading the reviews. I added 1 & 3/4C frozen blueberries dredged in a bit of flour to the batter. I also added about 1/2C Sour Cream to the batter. I baked it in a 8x12ish glass pan so I lowered the temperature to 325. This was better after it cooled and sat for awhile. Loved the texture- very dense and moist. Will make again.
Husband gave it a big thumbs up. I thought it was a little heavy & dry but had good flavor. Next time I’ll add more milk and blueberries..
yummy!
I’m not much of a baker, more a cook so I found the instructions a little confusing, but the end results were delicious. Definitely making this again.

I wish I had read some of the comments before making this cake. I would have use only half for the top layer. 
I was a little confused when I took it out if the pan
 should I turn it over or leave it as the bun. 
so I turn it over and it started to fall a part. Then I turn it back into the bun cake. I wish you had mentioned this is your video or direction. 
Overall it was ok but a little too sweet.

This was a hit at a coffee morning for my walking group.
I followed suggestions and doubled the blueberries, put chopped nuts in topping, used half topping on berries and made it in a springform pan. Delicious!

This was very good! I used a can of Oregon brand canned blueberries 15oz because it’s what I had on hand. The batter was crazy thick and I was worried about it but it cooked well. I checked it at 35 minutes and it was done. Any longer and it would it would be dry and burned. Next time I would put the topping in the middle layer with the blueberries. I thought it was weird and a little crunchy on the bottom but still very good!
DELICIOUS. Put in a 9x9 heavy ceramic baking dish. Put closer to 2/3 of the heavy batter (added 1-2 tablespoons more of milk).,

I absolutely LOVED this coffee cake! Recipe is perfect just the way it is. Cake is crunchy on the outside and moist and delicious on the inside. A real treasure for your taste buds. You won’t regret it!
Just too good. I made it for just my husband and myself, it was a lot (for us) so I share 2/3 with a neighbor who has 4 person household. VERY GOOD
excellent
This was uh-mazing. It was like a pound cake consistency. Delicious!
Substituted strawberries, turned out delicious. Don’t be afraid to use plenty of fruit to give a nice middle layer.
Made exactly as written and it was good but any cake without topping or blueberries was dry

I made this according to the recipe except for adding two teaspoons of lemon juice and using 2 cups of blueberries. I didn't understand why everyone else was thinning the batter out until I tried to pour it into the pan--it's impossible! I ended up smearing it all over the place. I have no regrets, because I don't think it would be nearly as heavy and delicious if I'd thinned it out, but it didn't exactly look like the picture. Also, it took 90 minutes to bake! But it's so delicious, who cares?
I made this for family and they absolutely LOVED it. I used fresh blueberries- more than 1 cup which made it even better. This is a great weekend coffee cake that everyone will enjoy.

I have made a few modifications and it comes out excellent this way as well...3/4 cup milk instead of 1/2 cup. Plus I fold in two cups fresh blueberries into the cake mix. Make the streusel topping as in recipe but place it all on the top and bake in springform pan. Everyone always loves it and Be prepares for friends to ask for the recipe!
Love this

I cut granulated sugar to 3/4 cup and used buttermilk instead of whole milk. I increased blueberries to 1 pint. I also used a 9” round free form cake pan that made it easier to layer batter, blueberries & streusel. Coffee cake is luscious with these changes!

This was very decadent. I didn’t have a bundt pan so used an oval ceramic dish. If you use a ceramic dish, it takes a little longer. But if you just keep checking with a tooth pick every 5 minutes after the called for time you won’t have an issue. The cake was so moist and flavorful, I almost didn’t want to share it. With the blueberries it evened out the sweet. The topping was flavorful and not too sweet. Be sure when making the crumble to work with cold butter so it doesn’t melt into a blob. That has happened before. The crust then gets really hard. This will definitely be my go to coffee cake recipe.

Followed the recipe exactly just to see and it was way too dry. Would try it again by adding another egg and a little more milk. Way too much strudel for just the bottom. I can see why some individuals altered this recipe.
Made it today and my family and I loved it. Will definitely make it again.
moist and delicious.
This cake was super moist and delicious! I was concerned because the batter was super thick, but the cake came out yummy!
Seemed a little heavy on the streusel topping but other than that good.
I've made this several times. I don't see where it needs to be changed. This is one of my favorite recipes.
It stuck so bad in the bundt cake pan. If I make it again I won’t put it in that pan. The topping stuck so no way to get it out. We will eat it as a crumb cake with ice cream.

I made it exactly as the recipe was written and it is very good. Next time I will shorten my baking time by 10 minutes as it
was slightly dry, albeit tasty. My oven may be running a little hotter, so I'll adjust. VERY tasty.
double the recipe!

This is sooooooo good! I made it exactly how the recipe calls for. It is very sweet but the blueberries balance it out, I used a pint of blueberries. This is my go to recipe for something sweet and quick! Next time I will half the strudel topping Bc it was way to much.
Yummy
I only need to review with stars because equestrian_baker was my first account on Allrecipes. So everything that it said is what I would have just said.

So we all really liked this and it was super easy to make!

Following some suggestions by other reviewers I used 3/4 cups milk and put the streusel topping in the middle. The streusel did make a LOT, so I put the extra in the freezer since I'll probably make this again. I also, as a personal preference, tossed the blueberries with some of the flour mixture and mixed them into the batter instead of just the middle layer.
Delicious and very moist!!
made it five times everyone loves it!
made it five times everyone loves it!

I made this with the extra milk and berries and it made the cake nice and moist which is how I prefer my cakes. You definitely don’t need all the topping and I recommend halving it. If you fold in the blueberries before putting the batter in the pan the berries spread out more. Overall a very good cake.
It was very good. Everyone loved it and was gone in one day. I did add an extra egg yolk and 2 cups of blueberries and didn't use all the crumb topping.
Pretty darn tasty, but messed up the streusel topping so the bottom was hard to cut, and made a crumbly mess. Probably needed to NOT soften the butter
This was delicious! I also used 1 1/2 C flour and 3/4 milk. I had no problem with sticking using a bunny pan. I will make this again it’s a keeper!
It was delicious and I added in 2 cups of blueberries, my family loved it.
Just what I was craving. Thank you!!!

I put a little of the topping in the middle of the coffee cake, which made it a lot of fun. I have made this twice now and both times I got rave reviews. Just make sure to flour your bundt pan well! This was truly delicious! A real party pleaser!
I made no changes to this recipe. I brought it to work for a fundraising and I typically taste something that I've never made before I put it out there. I got raving reviews!!
This turned out well, I enjoyed it. The recipe is straightforward and I made no changes except to reduce the streusel topping a little, as other reviews suggested.

I followed this recipe without any modifications. The coffee cake is dense, as I would expect for a coffee cake, but it is moist and flavorful. I think adding more milk as others did will result in a lighter cake texture. I guess it's an individual preference.
I gave this recipe 4 stars instead of 5 because I felt that there was too much streusel for the size of the cake and not enough blueberries. I'll adjust next time. 
Also next time, I think I'd use something other than a Bundt pan because I didn't like the streusel on the bottom of the cake when it's unmolded. Or maybe add the streusel in the middle with the blueberries. 
Overall this is a nice recipe for coffee cake.
The batter was too dry initially, had to add more milk. Was delicious though.
No changes made - cake was very dry.
This recipe is Fantastic!! I did not make any changes. The cake batter is thick, it’s supposed to be. I was nervous I did something wrong. It was exceptionally delicious!
The coffeecake was very good. I think regular sized berries would have been better than the jumbos I used because there would have been more of them. My husband loved the struesel.

I made a few little changes. Since my daughter has Celiac, a wheat allergy, I used all purpose gluten free flour (Pillsbury). I doubled the recipe so I could use a 13x9 pan. I didn't have enough apples so I used some crushed up pineapple. I let the batter sit in the fridge for an hour to help get rid of the horrible gritty taste from using gluten free flours. *a great tip when baking GF. Adjusted cook time until done. Very good!
Made as is except for gluten free flour & added 3/4t xanthan gum. Came out delicious with perfect consistency!
A total flop.

Made this today and after reading other reviews, changed to buttermilk and since I was adding lemon juice to regular milk to make it, I went ahead and used a full cup to the batter. Worked great! Very moist
Moist and delicious. A keeper.

I'd give it 5 stars with a few adjustments. It can definitely use 2 cups of blueberries. I used 1 cup of plain yogurt instead of 1/2 cup milk for a protein boost. Recipe for crumbs makes too much. I'll use about 3/4 of that next time.
It is delicious. A really moist cake. Easy to make. Does rise quickly. But I love it. Kinda messy so watch the kids! Aside from messy making it(less star). Easy and fun.

We have 24 blueberry bushes, so lots of blueberries! I’m always looking for more blueberry recipes. This one was really good.. I did change a couple of things.
3/4 c. Buttermilk instead of 1/2 c milk
2 cups of blueberries sprinkled with a little flour and mix with batter. (Instead of 1 cup of blueberries)
Also I divided the streusel in half & put 1/2 on 1/2 of the batter, add rest of batter and remaining streusel on top
This blueberry coffee cake was delicious! My family loved it!

This was outstanding. My expert taster says it’s the best cake he’s ever had. I accidentally used baking soda instead of powder, then added the powde too. Still turned out great. The only intentional change i made was reducing the sugar by about 25%. Wonderful!!
It was very tasty, but the streusel 'topping' (which inexplicably ended up on the bottom) was too hard and crunchy.

This is simple and yummy. The topping ends up underneath unless you flip it over. I used frozen blueberries, and they stayed in the middle like filling. I liked it, good flavour. Kept well, the whole family loved it.
I left the powdered sugar off to cut a few carbs off. Other than that great recipe.

I read the reviews and adjusted to what everyone said: I cut the flour to 1 1/2 cups and put some streusel in the center. What I got was a very dense, small bundt coffee cake and it wasn't very appetizing-looking. The flavor was just ok. I make coffee cakes every weekend and so I'm always looking for the winners. There are much better recipes out there. Won't make again.

Made this tonight ,following some other reviewers, added more blueberries which I folded into the batter, and added chopped pecans, only because I had them. I did put some of the topping in the bottom of the bundt pan, ( that will be the top when You pop it out) duh. I did add some Greek yogurt 1/4 cup since it still looked dry, even when I added 3/4 cup of milk. 
Came out very moist. Will definitely be making this again, over n over
It was very good and very easy to make. I may add slightly more blueberries next time I make it.

My husband and I really enjoyed this. As other reviewers suggested, I increased the milk to 3/4 cup, and added a streusel layer on top of the blueberries as well as on the top of the cake. The cake is so moist and the topping adds a nice chewy crunch! Will be adding this to our family brunches in the future!

I unfortunately didn't make any changes, though I thought I should through the whole process. I followed it to the letter and it ended up in the trash dry and over brown from the overload of sugar, also stuck to the pan. So I went to my cook's book and made one that came out perfectly. It wasn't the baker, it was the recipe

I gave it 4 stars because I made minor changes...1) I lightly greased my bundt pan with butter and dusted it with flour. I saw some say that it stuck to their pan. After some cooling and a gentle loosening of the sides using the dull side of the knife, it popped right out!

It is good - as other cooks say it needs adjustments to be 5 star. 1st time baked per recipe. Next time will double blueberries, increase milk (it was crumbly and would not hold together), increase cinnamon. Will decrease topping and add Oats & a tiny bit of molasses or honey drizzle in middle. Still - it is good place to start & smells great!

Favorite coffeecake to make for company and holidays (or any day you want to feel special). When I lived in Idaho I would use huckleberries in this, but now that I'm back in Florida I will have to use blueberries.
It was so delicious. Excellent recipe! Will definitely make it again and again.
Very Good Will be making again Thanks!
